caseTitle: REX V P. H. BRAVO JONES
summary: The appellant, P. H. Bravo Jones, was charged with forcible entry under 5 Ric. II c. 7 in Sierra Leone's Supreme Court. After the defense closed, the court amended the charge to 21 Jac. 1 c. 15 without requiring a new plea or allowing further defense. The jury convicted, and a fine or imprisonment was imposed. On appeal, the West African Court of Appeal held that amending the charge after the defense closed—especially to a substantively different offense—constituted a serious injustice. The court emphasized that such an amendment altered the nature of the charge and denied the appellant a fair opportunity to respond. The conviction and sentence were quashed, and an acquittal was entered.
legalKeywords: trial after submission of no case
citations: R. v. Tuttle (28 Cox C.C. 610; 21 Cr. App. Rep. 85)
R. v. Hughes (20 Cr. App. Rep. 4)
